DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate analgesic efficacy etoricoxib compare well know widely use non-steroid antinflammatory drug , ibuprofen , third molar extraction pain . At time , data efficacy etoricoxib reduce pain follow dental extraction . This single center , randomize , double-blind study , patient moderate severe pain follow third molar extraction randomize receive etoricoxib ( 120 mg single dose + 2 dose placebo pro day 3 day ) ibuprofen ( 1800 mg 3 dos pro day 3 day ) . Paracetamol plus codeine use rescue medication . Pain assessment perform use 11-point pain intensity scale ( 0 = pain 10 = worster pain ) first 3 day dental extraction . Patients enrol 15 day dental extraction . During enrollment visit complete clinical evaluation particular attention potential exclusion criterion ( e.g . hypertension cardiovascular risk factor ) well blood analysis perform . A follow-up visit perform 15 day dental extraction . Tolerability assess record adverse event .
DOC.brief_title: Etoricoxib Versus Ibuprofen Third Molar Extraction Pain
DOC.criteria: subject age > 18 year good health status ( assess occasion enrollment visit ) without major systemic illness candidate third molar extraction present local pain within 2 hour dental extraction patient major systemic illness patient clinical history drug abuse patient hypertension and/or condition increase cardiovascular risk pregnant lactating woman patient history hypersensitivity/allergy analgesic drug , include classical NSAID coxibs patient either high level liver enzymes ( major 1.5x upper limit reference interval ) creatinine ( major 1.2x upper limit reference interval ) patient either history peptic ulcer haemorrhagic diathesis patient ensure adequate compliance study
